title: Diary of a Very Bad Year: Confessions of an Anonymous Hedge Fund Manager
description: “Diary of a Very Bad Year is a rarity: a book on modern finance that’s both extraordinarily thoughtful and enormously entertaining.” — James Surowiecki, author of The Wisdom of Crowds   “A great read. . . . HFM offers a brilliant financial professional’s view of the economic situation in real time, from September 2007, when problems in financial markets began to surface, until late summer 2009.” — Booklist   “ n+1 is the rightful heir to Partisan Review and the New York Review of Books . It is rigorous, curious and provocative.” — Malcolm Gladwell   A profoundly candid and captivating account of the economic crisis and subprime mortgage collapse, from an anonymous hedge fund manager, as told to the editors of New York literary magazine n+1 .
author: Keith Gessen
